result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent R Nowak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brent R Nowak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brent R Nowak was found guilty of Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 28 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Remainder of fine to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Town of Mukwonago Police Department.  Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Letter received from defendant 7/21/17, advising that sentence modification no longer requested, as his mother is now deceased  **Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 7/21/17 - Ok.  No hearing needs to be set.**

Motion for Sentence Modification received from defendant 7/20/17; proof of mother's terminal diagnosis attached  **Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 7/20/17 - Set for 15 minute hearing.  He can appear by phone.**
Reply mailed to defendant, advising defendant must file a motion requesting early release, and give notice to the State

Letter received 6/28/17 from defendant, requesting early release to care for mother  **Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 6/28/17 - Letter reply to advise: A letter is not sufficient.  He must file a motion and give notice to the State.**

Defendant Brent R Nowak appeared by phone from Oakhill CI.  Attorney Amy C Scholz appeared in court for the defendant.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties make statements regarding the sentence modification request.  Court makes statements.  Court denies the motion at this time.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Defendant Brent R Nowak in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Abbey Nickolie and Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses previous plea taken and the letters filed on behalf of the defendant.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Scholz makes statements.  Defendants brother makes statements.  Defendants mother makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #2

Sentence of 

42 months Imprisonment (Credit - 28 days)
18 months of Initial Confinement
24 months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of extended supervision:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;

FINE:  $2073.00 bail to be applied, remainder to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Town of Mukwonago Police Department.

DL REVOCATION:  24 months.

IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 24 months.

AODA Assessment and follow through

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program

Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

records.addlTxt: Approved by Judge Maxwell 12/11/15

Defendant Brent R Nowak in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  Town of Mukwonago Police officer Andrew Douglass sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Nickolie.  Cross examination by Atty. Scholz.  Redirect by Atty. Nickolie.  Recross by Atty. Scholz.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Nickolie moves for bind over.  Atty. Scholz moves to dismiss.  Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Preliminary hearing at 12-10-2015 08:15 am

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint with the exception of the victim.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim, and not to discuss the case.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Cash bond previously posted.  Cash bond posted at Mukwonago Police Department.

Defendant Brent R Nowak in court with attorney Patricia Padurean for attorney Amy C Scholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses tampering of SCRAM monitor.  State moves to increase bail.  Defendant objects to any modification of bail.  Date remains as previously set.
